inn1.comm: fullish delivery on the middle swung back, Tharanga gets forward and punches it straight to the fielder at mid on
nice line, outside off stump shaping back into the left-hander who lets it go
fuller this time, Tharanga comes onto the front foot and drives firmly to cover
back of length, comes back off the seam and takes Tharanga high on the thigh pad
this one goes across the batsman, good variation after the early part of the over swung into him, Tharanga draws the bat inside the line and lets it go through to Paul Nixon
another comfortable leave as the ball flies past off stump with good carry through to Nixon
starts on leg stump, that's a gimme for Jayasuriya who flicks it fine down to the long leg boundary...poor start from Mahmood, pressure already on him
better line, on middle right up to Jayasuriya's toes and it's dug out towards midwicket
Mahmood has adjusted his line, outside off stump and Jayasuriya watches it go through to the keeper
back of a length, Jayasuriya jumps across his crease and plays with a straight bat back down the pitch
yorker from Mahmood, on offstump and Jayasuriya jabs down on it and the ball dribbles into the off side
pitched up on middle, Jayasuriya drives with half a bat up to mid on...good comeback from Mahmood after his first ball went for four
the first waft of the day...Anderson bowls outside off stump and Tharanga aims a booming drive but actually gets nowhere he the ball
ooh, good carry...just outside off stump, that trademark Anderson swing brings it back towards Tharanga who shoulders arms and Nixon takes it up around his chest

big shout, England reckon that's out but Billy Bowden says no. Swung back again, this time between bat and pad, Anderson and Nixon go up for the edge, but replays show it probably just clipped the back pad...good decision but also top bowling
more swing, slightly on leg stump this time and it takes the pad out to square leg
full, outside off stump, another firm drive but Tharanga again picks out cover...keeps the pressure on
finally he's off the mark, on middle and worked through midwicket with strong wrists, there's a comfortable brace to open his account
hint of width and Jayasuriya frees his arms and laces it through backward point...he's plenty of those during his ODI career and Mahmood just can't afford to stray, even a little bit
that's better from Mahmood, on middle and draws Jayasuriya onto the front foot and defended to cover
gee, he barely touched that, really just a defensive push into the off side, but the timing was so good it raced through cover and almost made it to the boundary...outfield and pitch looking good
ah, there we go, Mahmood's first no ball of the day and Tharanga gets a bottom edge to a wide ball for a single down to third man
back of a length, tries to tuck it into the on side but is taken on the pad
pitched up on off stump at 85mph (136kph) and Jayasuriya comes forward with another well-timed push, this time fielded by Pietersen at cover
first slower ball of the day, turns into a low full toss, carefully watches and pushed to point
Anderson keeps his good start going, on middle and played firmly up to mid on...but England need pressure from both ends
there's the other one, angles across the left-hander who lets in go
comes forward and, like Jayasuriya earlier, just pushes at the ball and it beats the infield through cover for a brace
encouraging carry for Anderson as this one goes through to the keeper
half volley, outside off stump and Tharanga drives through the covers but without properly timing it...dribbles halfway towards the fence
well bowl, pushed across Tharanga who feels for it and almost gets an edge...again Nixon takes the ball on the rise
pace from Mahmood, around 86mph (138kph), but too much on leg stump and thuds into the tight pad and drops into the leg side
Tharanga waits for this and uses the pace of the ball to turn it down behind square on the leg side
sharp bouncer, good aggression from Mahmood and Jayasuriya makes the late decision to turn his head away from the ball...wasn't a million miles from taking a blow
forced back into his crease by that last ball...turns this towards square leg off middle stump
this is better from Mahmood, again keeps Jayasuriya planted well back on his stumps and the ball climbs, takes the splice of the bat and falls down the feet
on off stump, Jayasuriya comes across and plays back to Mahmood
stands tall, plays the ball at the top of the bounce and forces down to mid off
back of a length, Tharanga has time to flick it just to the left of mid on for a comfortable single
short and Jayasuriya is quickly onto it, rocks back and pulls over square leg...Mahmood makes good ground but in flicking the ball back he then kicks it over the rope, doh.
back and across, played down the pitch
ah, that's brilliant batting...after the earlier boundary Vaughan moved Mahmood square, so Jayasuriya flicks this one from middle down to the fine leg boundary which is now unprotected
finishes with a waft, outside off stump but Jayasuriya - for once - misses a cut
short, on the hip, and flicked down to long leg
gets behind this with a solid defence, back to Mahmood
ooh, nearly...short from Mahmood and a little extra bounce surprises Jayasuriya who tries to turn it through the leg side and gets a leading edge which falls short of Mahmood in his follow through
bouncer, Jayasuriya gets a big top edge on it which flies fine and goes all the way for the first six of the day...the extra bounce in the surface helped that go for six
goes very full this time, dug out into the covers

gone! there's the breakthrough for England and it's the huge scalp of Jayasuriya...Mahmood kept his pace going, this one was tight on off stump and is defended with an angled bat and the ball crashes it the stumps. Delight for Mahmood and Vaughan, who looks really pumped at that wicket
on middle, Tharanga plays from the crease down the pitch
goes across Tharanga, left alone comfortably and through to Nixon

full and wide, Tharanga opens his shoulders and drives handsomely behind square on the off side...Panesar makes good ground from third man, slides and picks up...and gets a huge cheer from the England fans
not convincing from Tharanga, on middle and looks to keep a fraction low...gets a thick inside edge past the stumps and down to long leg
back to the bowler with a straight bat
just outside off stump, tight stuff from Anderson and Tharanga covers up
Sangakkara drives his first ball firmly to mid off
good yorker, Sangakkara is quickly down it and also aware another to grab a quick single as the ball falls dead by his feet...good cricket from everyone
pulls his length back this time, mixing it up a lot, Tharanga turns it to midwicket
goes full again this time, not quite a yorker and Tharanga punches up to mid off, who is deep so there's an easy single
now it's a slower ball, turned backward of square into the leg side, I don't think he's bowled two of the same balls consecutively
firmly back to Mahmood, tidy over to keep the lid on the scoring rate
more tidy stuff from Jim, who's staying over by the way, and rushes that one past the outside edge
straighter ball, this one, and that's defended
down the hallway of hesitancy this time and it's left alone with a big rise of the arms
straighter, and there's a satisfying "Thlock" as the batsman moves backward to defend with a straight bat
short and Sangakkara's eyes light up - he likes pulling, he does - but he doesn't get hold of it and is lucky to find space at midwicket
driven forward, and Sangakkara waits a split-second until he sees Anderson hasn't stopped it and the batsmen shuffle through for a quick, strike-stealing single
a touch short, outside off, and that's driven to the covers
over the wicket, by the way, and that one fleets past the outside edge, but not near enough to pose too many problems
oversteps this time and that's a bonus ball for Sri Lanka, this delivery just driven slowly to cover
outside off and the batsman stops on the drive, stunning it into the covers
a good line again, and that carries well through to Nixon
on off - nagging stuff from Flintoff - and that's defended to Vaughan in the covers
pushed up there, a touch of width, but he can't quite get the middle of the bat on it
on middle and that's poked down into the covers, no room there for a drive or similar
great shot, a well-timed push through the covers and that brings up the fifty for Sri Lanka
on middle and leg and Tharanga looks to ease that one off the thigh into midwicket, but it's a bit too full for that kind of behaviour and he stops on the shot
this one's driven to mid-on this time
squares up to that one, the ball straying into the off-side and Collingwood is on to that one quickly
driven to cover this time
stays over the wicket and that's straight and Sangakkara jumps back to defend it as solidly as something very solid indeed

poked out into the covers, Bell's commitment faultless as he dives to his left, stops, and zzzooms it back in (sorry about the zzz, sticky keyboard from a spilt coffee moment) but there's still time for a quick single
driven into the covers again
well-taken single that, Sangakkara driving to extra cover and there's a good understanding between the batting pair
just too full and that's an excellent shot from the batsman, really making the most of it, as he leans into that cover drive and it courses away
on off and that's defended down
very fine pad action down to leg
lurvely ball there, nipping away from the lefthander off the seam and Tharanga's tempted, oh-so-tempted, to play ... but he gets a let-off
worked into the covers
gets on the front foot and that's an easy drive forward for a quick single
...and so he fails to locate the middle, just driving that without much timing to cover

short, Anderson saw him coming, and adjusts the ball, nevertheless the batsman manages to aggressively whip that one square with a delicious pull, playing off about 18 yards by the time he got down the track
outside off and that's defended down
round the wicket and that's driven through cover beating the fielder who chased behind it all the way
defended on the back foot this time
driven forward and that's picked up at long-off

angles that one in at the lefthander, there's just a touch of width outside off, but the length's good and all the batsman can do is defend. Well, obviously he could do other things, but he chose the sensible option
driven into the covers
driven to mid-on
left alone outside off
played into the leg side
tucked into the leg side off the pads
pushed right up there and that's driven back, without much power, to mid-off
defended forward this time
round the wicket and that's rushed past the outside edge
outside off and that's driven into the covers
straight and Sangakkara does well to work that into the leg side and there's more of the good stuff with a quick single. Panesar at mid-on does the tidying up
very good delivery, that one rearing up off the track, but that's a good snaking leave from the batsman
defended off the back foot into the covers
straight and dealt with well, tucking that off the thigh into midwicket
change of pace, change of ends and that's a slow, wide, low full toss which is carved off the back foot to Collingwood for a pretty comfortable catch
oh, a thick outside edge but that went to ground wide of the slips. Still, that's encouragement for the bowler
outside off and that's worked down without too much fuss
bizarreness, Vaughan appeared to be on the pitch there at silly mid-on as he snapped the ball down low on the bounce
played down off the back foot
outside off that that's driven out through the covers but it's chased down inside the boundary
a quick single rounds off the over
round the wicket and that one angles in at the lefthander who makes room to work that behind square
over the wicket to the righthander, orthodoxly enough as it were, and that's defended down
that one nips in from outside off and Jayawardene defends tidily
defends on the back foot this time

nips from outside off just to say back into the batsman who tucks it down off the back foot and there's some aggression-tastic action from Bopara in the gully, diving to his left, then crashing the ball back on one knee
looser ball but nevertheless it's well worked out through midwicket for a three to end the over
starts with a near yorker, easily dug out by Jayawardene
floated up outside off stump, just a hint of movement but firmly driven out through cover
pitched on middle at a very gentle pace, Tharanga pushes square into the covers
drifting down the leg side...that's the first wide of the innings
short and wide, cut away but Bopara makes another superb diving save at backward point, parries the ball to his right and there's a single...but it could have four
driven firmly up to mid off, Jayawardene sets off straight away and despite a rocket throw from Flintoff he gets in easily
slower ball, if Collingwood can get much slower, 60mph (100kph) and Tharanga watchfully defends it under his nose
short and helped around the corner with a well controlled swivel-pull...goes straight to long leg so just the one
round the wicket from Flintoff, on middle and worked up to mid on who is standing fairly deep
probing line outside off stump, Jayawardene comes forward and angles towards backward point
driven on the up but straight to Ian Bell at cover...the Sri Lankan batsmen haven't been at their free-flowing best today, credit must go to the England attack
Flintoff tries a slower ball, turns into a low full toss and a fumble by Vaughan at short cover allows a single
hits the bat hard from back of a length, Flintoff skips across the pitch to collect
full on middle and off, again a Jayawardene drives goes straight to cover
same again, from all fronts, and Ian Bell fields at cover
finds the gap this time, and with timing, as he pierces the gap between cover and mid off...the ball races away for a welcome boundary, Jayawardene's first
slower ball, well watched and flicked into the on side
another well disguised slower ball, in off-cutter style, and Jayawardene misses as he tries to glide it to third man
driven slightly in the air but well wide of Collingwood down to long off
flighted onto middle and leg, turned through midwicket
outside off stump, Tharanga probs it back to Panesar
not much flight, again tapped back to the bowler
invention from Tharanga, well outside off stump but he comes across and paddles it to the short fine-leg area
solid forward defence
paddled round the corner, no one at 45 so it's an easy single
on off stump, Jayawardene pushes into the covers

basically a long hop from Collingwood, and at his pace it's a very gentle offering to Jayawardene who swings it down to long leg...Panesar makes good ground but can't drag it back, not helped by the sandy outfield
lofted straight past mid off, but not perfectly timed and it pulls up short of the boundary...hint of aggression from Jayawardene
firmly punched into the off side, but doesn't find the gap
driven and well placed this time, past cover and down to long off
full on off stump, another single to mid off who is on the edge of the circle
slightly short, tucked to backward square
uses his feet but just punches to cover
outside off stump, Tharanga sweeps firmly in front of square and Mahmood comes round from deep midwicket to clean up
hint of loop that time, Jayawardene drives softly to cover
plays forward, inside edge rolls into the leg side
prodded into the leg side, midwicket is slightly on his heels and they scamper a single to finish the over
starts on leg stump, takes the pad to short fine leg
very slow from Vaughan 50mph (80kph) and tickled to short fine leg
more loopy doopy stuff, worked with the wrists through square leg
full on middle and flicked through square leg
looped up under Jayawardene's eyes and he works it down to long on without any fuss
beats Vaughan's rather arthritic dive and goes down to long on
flat outside off stump, Tharanga brings out his paddle and works out to the deep backward square-leg fence
more paddles than a boating lake in the middle at the moment, Jayawardene gets a single fine on the leg side
that's one of Tharanga's best timed shots, drives through the covers but he still can't find the boundary as Pietersen runs round the rope
forced back to Panesar
short and angled away through backward point, Tharanga drops his bat as he turns for the second but still manages to come back as Flintoff comes round from deep cover and it's three in the end
ooh, slight mix-up at cover as Jayawardene pushes forward and calls Tharanga through but he gets home in time and it only takes a momentary look from the third umpire to confirm so...fifty stand up
flighted low full toss, punched up to long on
draws the batsman forward, thick inside edge to square leg
drifting down the leg side, shovelled round the corner and Panesar runs round from deep square leg
just a forward push, but mid on is vacant and it's an easy single
short, Tharanga rocks back and cuts but straight to backward point
slightly quicker, driven back to Vaughan
driven down the ground, Monty dives over it...Paul Nixon not happy
top shot, uses his feat and lofted over mid off, who is in the circle, and it doesn't plug in the sandy outfield...Tharanga finally has a boundary
tucked into the leg side
pushed into the covers

lofted down the ground to long off, Anderson seems to give up very early on an attempt to catch it and instead opts to stop the boundary...he's still wearing a bandage on his finger but it wasn't a very committed effort
blocked back to Panesar
right up there, straight, and that's defended
a touch shorter and that's whisked to the midwicket
on leg and the batman leans over to swish that one square
more strike roation, this time a cover drive
yet another quick single, good stuff from the batsmen
paddled round to short fine leg and "Catch it" jokes Nixon as it lands short
plays that one easily through midwicket for an easy single
on off, that's straight to the man at point who does indeed "Get it, get it" at Nixon's behest
driven to the man just in front of an orthodox mid-off
pushed right up there and that's driven back to the bowler without much power
Bell misfields at extra cover, a regulation stop, but he hashes the long barrier and they eek a single
soft hands and he opens the face for a good two
outside off and that's driven wide of mid-on where it just dribbles and it's picked up easily
a touch of width from Panesar and he opens the face to ease that down to third man to bring up a well-caressed fifty
a forward drive eludes a groping Panesar and there's an easy enough single
lovely shot, Jayawardene bisecting the two men in front and behind square and that's a really elegant sweep, down on one knee
on one knee again and that's a lovely drive to cover
on middle and "Wrong line" chastises William Lukesford as that one's swept to square
offers too much width and that's firmly driven away behind point to bring the 150 up
wobbles that one in at the batsman, but a bit too much wobble, and that's driven off the legs in midwicket, sumptuous shot, even if one without much power
drags that a touch short and that's taken from outside off and driven through cover
driven out through cover for an easy two
defended this time
a very quiet single just poked forward with a straight bat
finds the button immediately and that's driven back to mid-off
too much width outside off - you can't bowl there to him - and that's flashed so hard with great wrists, late, through gully. Corker
driven to cover
short, rising and that's cut straight behind point where one of Tweedledum and -Dee pick it up
banged in outside and that's a mistimed pull sliced up to Pietersen, who makes a Powerplay-esque sign with his whirly arms in delight
attempted inswinging yorker first ball to Silva, but that's a low full toss and the England team forget their consonants in their Oooaaaa appeal; it was straying down leg
outside off and that's driven square to point
typical Panesar, zeroing in on a stifling delivery, with one which offers no room other than to defend
driven out to cover, they think about running, but do the sensible thing and don't
down on one knee to sweep early, mistimes it, but still sends it rolling to midwicket
waits, waits, and uses the width to cut that through point, a lovely dink, and that's his half-century in 51 balls, his third against England
defended forward
outside off and that's defended to point
outside off again, but with enough room for that one to be guided out behind point
defended off the back foot this time, that one again in the same area
oh, nearly gets his man, with a searing full delivery which nips in on middle and the batsman plays late, just jabbing his bat down. Good bowling
squares him up with a jaffa that would be up for Citrus Fruit of the Year, a lovely juicy specimen, just flouncing past the outside edge as the batsman leaps back
driven out in front of point, a commanding shot this time
defended out to mid-on
on middle and leg and does well to connect with the sweep, else that would have been a good shout, but picked the fielder
a big backswing and that's driven straight to long-off
dances down and drives that well in front of midwicket. There's some nifty running, too
driven to cover
unconvincing attempt to take that from outside off and sweep it; misses completely, playing under the ball, down on one knee
pitched right up there, straight, and that's defended forward
driven to long-off this time
on leg and that's tucked off the legs behind square, a deft touch from Jayawardene and Panesar does his best with a sliding dive, but can't get there in time
just a touch of width outside off and Jayawardene's eyes light up - but then so do Joyce's in the deep - as the batsman smashes that aerially in front of midwicket
slower delivery and he's tempted to swish at it, misses though
comes forward and there's a textbook forward defence
pushed right up there and that's defended
just fell short of Anderson at mid-on, the fielder doing well to get his body behind it at least
swept off the knee through midwicket and that's some lovely timing
comes down and swipes that in front of midwicket, his bottom hand coming into play, urgency creeping into this innings right now
on the front foot and he can only stifle that in defence
played that with hands-that-do-dishes soft hands and there's a cheeky single there, which we like
angled to backward point
another dot as Silva comes onto the front foot and defends
slower ball, slightly shorter but Silva misses out as he tries to turn it into the leg side
driven into the covers, but it's just a single
on middle, sliced away to backward point and he can't beat the field
Dilshan slams this, but straight to cover and Bopara prevents any runs...he's outstanding in the field
starts with a slower ball, Silva tries to run it to third man but the edge doesn't carry to Nixon

that's a shocker from Mahmood, tries another slower ball but it's a horrendous low full toss way down the leg side and Silva does well to actually get any bat on it...no stopping it into the fine-leg fence
wide and pushed to backward point
full, hint of late movement into the batsmen who drives it to mid off...Panesar can't prevent the single
short and pulled away through square leg, Pietersen prevents a boundary but Silva showing good placement and timing
good yorker, well dug out to backward point...Collingwood throws at the non-striker's end, misses and they get an overthrow

outstanding work from Bell! Silva drives firmly to cover, Bell dives and makes a great stop, stands up, aims at one stump and hits the target, Dilshan is well short...vital breakthrough for England and the rare sight of them hitting the stumps direct
rides the extra bounce well, plays down in front of backward point
firmly back to Anderson who fields well in his follow through
flicks this away neatly through square leg but it's just a single
chopped down by his feet...well taken single
outside off stump, Arnold comes forward and defends the ball into the on side...Anderson tries to get across but Silva runs in front of him
half an appeal as Arnold tries to work this through the leg side, but the ball pitched well outside leg stump
driven nicely through the covers and with the placement for two as Pietersen fields
chopped away to third man...brings up the 200
straight on middle, Silva can only work it back to Collingwood
tries to flick through the on side, but goes straight to midwicket
clever slower ball, loops outside off stump and Silva completely misses his drive...another tight over from Collingwood
well outside off stump but Arnold drives straight to backward point...good stuff from England
driven past a diving cover, but it's only a single as mid off is up and runs round to complete the work
drifting into the pads, dropped into the leg side but England won't mind the ones
short and into Arnold's body, he works it around the corner down to fine leg
full and well dug out down the ground, it's actually struck extremely well and Bopara isn't helped by an outfield on the boundary edge which resemble a beach more than a cricket field
pushed into the covers, a scampered single
uses the angle and runs the ball off the face down to third man
well played, on middle and Silva gets down and sweeps the medium-pacer towards fine leg
floaty and outside off stump, slapped through the covers to the man on the fence
nearly back to Collingwood on the full, Arnold drives but is beaten by a slight change of pace
full face, driven up to long off
and tries to sweep Collingwood again, he misses but so does Nixon and it's a rare bye against the keeper
there we go, that's how to bowl at the death...full and straight spearing in at middle stump, it goes right through Silva and into middle stump. England continue to chip away
outside off stump, pushed towards backward and well fielded...England have been sharp all morning
low full toss, heading towards middle and Vaas can't get it away...goes straight to cover
short and Vaas launches into a pull but doesn't really middle it...he picks up a couple through midwicket
thumped down the ground towards long off, falls well short, easy two

gone! more outstanding work from England, outside off stump and Vaas pushes at it, the ball flies towards backward point and Collingwood, who has just been moved there, dives to his right, flings out his hand and pulls off a top catch
Collingwood starts another...straight on middle and Arnold blocks
driven down to long off
worked to midwicket
opens the face and runs it down to third man
on leg stump but Arnold can't find the gap at midwicket
another dot, excellent work from Collingwood, as this is driven to cover
meanwhile Flintoff starts his last over with a bouncer, Malinga sways out of the way
top yorker, Malinga can only dig it out to midwicket
short and at Malinga's rib cage, he swings it away backward of square for a single..at least that gives Arnold the bowling
firm on drive, Arnold drilled that off the middle but it hits the non-striker and rebounds towards mid off...that could have cost Sri Lanka three runs, it was travelling
low full toss, Malinga swings and misses and the ball is inches from taking out leg stump...Nixon makes a great save with his left hand
driven in the air past Collingwood at backward point...England's Superman can't get a hand on it...but Panesar prevents a boundary at third man
gone! bangs it in, Malinga goes for the pull and it goes high put not very far...Nixon runs from his position and takes it heading back towards the fine-leg rope
low full toss outside off stump, driven down to long on...it's over to the unique batting skills of Murali
full toss heading at Murali's pads, he swings it down to fine leg...Mahmood got away with that against his Lancashire team-mate
wasteful from Mahmood, very wide and also Nixon fumbles with the gloves so it's three wides

gone! it really has been Mahmood's day so far, a low full toss on middle stump and Arnold swings it away off the middle towards deep midwicket...but straight at Ed Joyce who snaffles his second catch of the innings...and that's a career-best ODI effort from Mahmood
another short ball, Fernando gets a bottom edge which bounces to the keeper and they scramble a run
waist-height full toss and it's called by Asad Rauf, apologies all round and Murali is just pleased that didn't crush his spinning finger...purely an accident from Mahmood as he aimed for the yorker
all out! slower ball, swung away through midwicket...Pietersen fields in the deep and his throw catches Fernando short as Nixon breaks the stumps

inn2.comm: left alone outside off first up, that's a tidy start from Vaas, haard and faast
made him play this time, and such was his line-and-length, he made him play a backfoot defensive
more defence
late swing as that one, erm, swings late past the batsman's outside edge - too wide to be of interest - and swings some more on its way through
pushes that across the lefthander who gets off the mark with a firm prod-push with a straight bat into the covers
over the wicket and that's zoomed in at the batsman, full, and Vaughan prods into the cover
over the wicket and angles that across the lefthander who left it alone
right up there, on a good length, and that was defended forward
on off and that's defended forward
outside off and that's well driven, but not well placed, going straight to the man at cover
left alone outside off as that one stayed low, the slower one dying on the pitch
outside off and left alone again - and that's a tidy maiden all right
outside off and Vaughan shapes to drive that to cover, in fact he does drive it, but it's straight to the man, there
early strike and that's strangled down leg, Sangakkara snapping up a tidy catch, standing up there and Bowden took his time to deliver the crooked finger
straight delivery, a touch of swing, and Vaas is already into his groove here
played to gully
cut to point off the back foot
over the wicket and that's defended forward
poked down off the back foot to gully
on off and that's worked into the covers, Bell keen for a single, but realising there wasn't one on
driven forward to get off the mark
defended forward
change of pace, that one pitching on off and worked into the covers
dinked down to point without much pace off the back foot
edged and that eludes Jayawardene at second slip - it was, to be fair and we are, played down with soft hands
banana swing away from the lefthander and that's rushed through almost before Joyce has time to think about leaving it
overpitches and Joyce doesn't miss out, straight-driving that one to... was it the boundary? Did Murali get it? Replays will tell us... Yes, neat work!
left alone outside off, a good length this one, and that's snapped again by Sangakkara
a touch on middle and leg and that's swished off the hips in front of square
worked into midwicket
slung in bullet-straight and up there and the batsman can only defend if he wants to face another ball

pitches on leg and this time Malinga strikes! Clever bowling, kept it up to the batsman and there wasn't much movement of the feet, in fact hardly any at all. The finger goes up immediately, and there wasn't really much doubt at all, HawkEye confirming it would have gone on to clip leg stick
strays a touch on leg and that was driven through mid-on first up
defended on the back foot
oh, hello, nearly had another man there, slanting that one naughtily past Bell's outside edge, moving it away in the air as he did so
defended again and that rounds off a splendid over
doesn't quite get the length right, and that's straight, allowing the batsman to swish that to midwicket - but, what's this? Nearly a run out for Pietersen - a direct hit would have had him
walks into that one and goes to lash a cover drive, but can't connect properly and drives that into the ground, Silva with a very agile piece of fielding close in
shot for none, width and Pietersen down on one knee and flashing that one to cover, Silva again proving an impenetrable wall
left alone outside off, that one slanting across the righthander - Pietersen smiles afterwards
on leg and Pietersen aims to drive that back out to mid-on, but he's still playing himself in at this stage and didn't connect cleanly
drives that one into the ground, Pietersen scratching around at this stage
tucked off the legs and that's an easy two out to deep midwicket
driven to long-on
slower ball and Bell again has the opportunity to prove he's strong off his pads, leaning into this one and driving out to mid-on
on the money and Pietersen can't get any purchase
worked into the leg side, but for no run
tries the bouncer but Pietersen doesn't miss out - on to it so quickly and pulling that one in front of midwicket and it races away
driven through cover
on off and that's driven to mid-on this time
pushes that one outside off and the batsman comes forward and gets right over the ball in driving to cover
on the money
outside off, the batsman reaches out to drive that to cover and there's some urgency and vitality about the Sri Lankan fielders
outside off and that's cut away behind point - Fernando's throw comes back in wide and England did well to pick that and grab the second
on off and that's driven into the ground back towards the bowler
driven on the up through extra cover and it hops up, almost apologetically, over the rope
more driving, on the up again, but this time picks out the fielder
better ball, defended on the back foot this time
dances down and slams that off the back foot with a mis-timed drive through cover
driven into the ground, straight to the fielder
firm straight drive from Bell, Vaas gets a hand to it and tries to flick it back into the stumps but Pietersen gets back
cut away to backward point
nice shot, square drive using the angle from Vaas, finds the gap between the two men either side of point and it races away...welcome boundary for Bell
on the hips, Bell uses nice wrist work to send the ball through square leg for a brace...Sangakkara clips the stumps and there's half an appeal for hit wicket by a few Sri Lankans
nicely turned into the midwicket region
that's the best of Pietersen, straight six back over the bowler's end and it sails handsomely over the ropes...effortless and pure timing from KP
ooh, Bell's a lucky boy there...he goes for the drive but gets an inside edge which evades the stumps and also Sangakkara, races away down to the boundary
rides some extra bounce, played down by his feat and bobbles back to the keeper...thick of a run but it's not there
angles the bat and sends this to backward point
gets on top of the bounce and defends back down the pitch, Fernando fields in his follow through
fuller this time, on off stump, Bell comes forward and drives to mid off
on middle, firm punch back to the bowler
Pietersen goes up and over midwicket, with Vaas's natural swing...not perfectly timed but crossed the rope with ease...KP is off and running
awesome timing, he just leans on this and finds the gap at cover...but some very shoddy running means he just gets two...he probably wants to keep the strike, but it look very lazy
worked up to long off
angled down to third man, keeps the strike rotating...useful stand forming between these two
huge appeal, Billy Bowden shakes his head...but it pitched well outside leg and Sangakkara's appeal was actually fairly tame by his standards
shuffles around the crease, driven back to Vaas who collects
short and wide from Fernando, down towards wide third man...Vaas runs round the rope and keeps it to two
played from the crease, back to the bowler
outside off stump, on a good length, Bell pushes firmly into the off side
forced off the back foot into the covers
ooh, action all round! Bell drives with power to mid off, sets off for a run but if Jayasuriya had hit he would have been short...as it is it's a fifty stand off 51 balls
played from the top of the bounce into the covers
outside off stump, pushed into the covers
too much width from Vaas and Bell picks the gap square on the off side...well placed, well time, top shot
better line and length, played out to point
beautifully driven on the up between cover and mid off, Bell is ticking now and England making nice progess
rocks back and cuts this to backward point
angled into the off side, nothing on offer there
neatly punched to long on
work down the ground
pushed into the off side
straight bat into the leg side
Jayasuriya bowling full, guided up to long on
Bell tries to use his feet, but just finds midwicket...and it's Drinks
bat and pad together
skips down the track, fires the ball to long off
forced down to long on, fraction short from Dilshan
uses his feet, takes a thick inside part of the bat towards midwicket
moves back and punches to midwicket
flatter and quicker, Bell gets down on it and works to square leg...Dilshan gets through his overs quickly
very full, driven to midwicket
round the wicket, drifting wide of leg stump and flicked out to deep midwicket
cheeky! Bell brings out the reverse sweep and plays it well, deflects the ball down through short third man, who chases it down well to prevent the boundary...good work from Silva
flighted, but too much on the legs and easily flicked out to deep midwicket
Bell waits for it and works into square leg
driven to midwicket, a fumble from Jayawardene but it doesn't cost anything
played with a straight bat to midwicket
flat from Dilshan, punched back up the pitch
more flight this time, flicked back to Dilshan who makes a sharp diving save, parrying the ball to midwicket
tight stuff from Dilshan, fields again off his own bowling
Bell just getting stuck in this over...again back to Dilshan
same again to finish...a maiden over, well bowled but Bell could have tried a little harder to work the ball off the square
KP skips down the pitch, but just punches to midwicket
low full toss, firmly driven up the pitch and Jayasuriya flicks it past the timber
touch short, cut out to deep cover
comes forward, soft hands, into the covers
all defence from Pietersen...some by-play with Jayasuriya who made him wait
drifting onto the pads, tickled to short fine-leg where Murali fields and clearly isn't fit...this could be a vital part of the match.
drives to short mid-on, and that's picked up easily enough
defended forward

drags that short, the batsman comes down the pitch, tickles to mid-on and "That's gone!" we all scream before Jayawardene makes a hash of the throw, chucking it wide to Sangakkara and Bell got home in time
turns toward leg and that's worked to midwicket
outside off and the batsman prods the ball into the covers
splashes that one onto leg and it's tucked off the hips easily enough
reaches out to try to reverse sweep and doesn't quite connect cleanly
plants that one right on off, up there, and all the batsman can do is defend
the bowler picks up the ball tidily as it's driven back to him
on middle and that's turned away gently to midwicket
up there again and the batsman drives back, slowly, to Jayasuriya
creeps over to defend tidily to round off a quiet over, good placement from the bowler
on off, a touch of room, and that's eased to midwicket
a touch of wibble-wobble in the air, Pietersen takes one of his big strides forwards and pushes that through mid-off
this time it's Bell who comes forward and he ekes it to point
pushed it right up there and defended over - no room to do anything with that one
driven back to the bowler, who crouches low to pick it up
strides into that one and drives it to mid-on
good use of the feet to one which was veering wide down leg, and that's squished out in front of midwicket
on middle, back to the bowler and that's "Bowling!"
on middle and leg, and that's driven out to Malinga at long-on
pushed it up there and that's defended this time
a quick single
another quick single, this one dabbed down to short third man
Pietersen signals his intent from the off against Murali, down the track and driving that to mid-off
the doosra, Bell tickling it off his legs in front of midwicket
on middle, that's close as Bell gets an inside edge
round the wicket, by the way, and that's swept tidily this time, some good fielding behind square
Bell reaches outside off for that one perilously to sweep it to midwicket
outside off and even Pietersen, for a nanosecond, worries if he's got a snick on the ball as he shapes to cut and the ball's pouched by Sangakkara; he didn't edge it
Bell waits for that one and drives it off the legs, as is his wont, to midwicket

on leg and that's driven straight, Jayasuriya appealing for a flick on to the stumps - was Bell out of his crease at the non-striker's end? His bat's in the air, did Jayasuriya get a hand on it? A million replays are needed, each of them looking tantalizingly close and in the end the third umpire thinks he can build all the pieces together to give it out - and that's a good decision
defended forward first up
waited and drove that straight towards long-on
defended this time
tucks up Pietersen and that's just poked down
big shout, but maybe just going over middle and maybe saved by the big stride - HawkEye has it hitting off, just, but it's marginal and the benefit must be with the batsman
defended forward
more defence, this time to leg
even more of the defensive stuff
...and a final defence to end the over
on off, that's worked to mid-on and there's a tight single - a direct hit would have had Collingwood way, way out
driven forward to mid-off
planted temptingly outside off and that's driven to cover
dragged down a touch, but straight, and the batsman can only defended on the back foot
in the air, a chip towards mid-on, but too short for Malinga
flicked to square leg, taking the fielder on
catchers round the bat on the off side, here, and that's defended forward, not giving any of them a sniff
did him with the doosra, but the ball turned just too much to contact with the off stump
a touch of width and that's played down off the back foot behind square
that one's straight, and Pietersen comes down the track, but in the end he has to settle for a forward defence
again Pietersen's aggressive, down the pitch, and works that away in front of midwicket
pushed right up there, prompting Pietersen to defend and Murali is gradually squeezing England here, while the run-rate creeps up - it's now 6.05 required from the last 21 overs
pushed up there, yorker in fact, and that's dug out with the very toe of the bat
another inswinging yorker and there's not much you can do with those - lovely stuff from Malinga
overstepped this time
a touch of width and that's on leg, too, Pietersen swishing it away in front of square to bring up his fifty
gets it wrong again, just too short to be a genuine Yorker and that's clipped away behind square and the man in the deep
clipped again, this time to deep midwicket only
outside off this time, but that's smashed straight to the man at cover
that's made into a half-volley and driven beautifully straight
cuts into the covers
tries to charge Murali, never an easy thing, length is shorter and it takes an effort to make sure Pietersen just gets something on it
top shot! outside off stump, Pietersen unleashes a crunching sweep and the ball whistles to the square leg boundary
again uses his feet, Murali holds it back and tucked to midwicket

gone! that could be the defining moment, Pietersen tries to work a doosra through the on side and gets a leading edge back to Murali, who gobbles it up in his follow through...how many times have we seen that and game tilts back to Sri Lanka
beaten first ball! didn't pick the doosra, Flintoff rarely does, and prods unconvincingly as the ball fizzes past the edge
worked off middle stump out to deep square-leg
huge shout, so huge Fernando falls over in his follow through...Flintoff is caught on the crease but it's just shaping down the leg side
forced back down the pitch
driven firmly but short cover makes an athletic save
Flintoff looking edgy...plays from the crease and gets a thick edge into his pads
very full, searching for reverse swing, Flintoff digs it out through midwicket and opens his account
comes half forward, bat and pad together
same again from Collingwood...forward and solid
lunges at this one...keeps silly point interested but it came straight off the pad
quicker and flatter...Collingwood almost caught by surprise
plenty of turn, but spins down the leg side...an appeal but it was nowhere near the bat
delightful shot! Collingwood dances down the track, gets to the pitch and drives with power and precision wide off mid off

gone! brilliant bowling from Fernando, completely deceived by the slower ball, tries to go over mid on but only gets it as far as Malinga on the edge of the circle and that puts Sri Lanka firmly in the driving seat
batsmen crossed, Collingwood defends this out towards point

gone! and that almost certainly seals the deal...Collingwood is trapped on the crease as Fernando slips a quicker one through his defence. That was taking out middle half way up, no doubt about it...what a spell from Sri Lanka, who are showing why they are many people's favourites to win the World Cup
full and fast outside off stump, Nixon doesn't get near it and it's a tough take for Sangakkara

it's all going on...the ball bobbles off Nixon's body, Bopara calls the run, Nixon doesn't know where the ball is but the attempted kick misses the stumps...stick to cricket guys, rather than football
big full toss but Bopara can only work it to midwicket
gee, what's going on here! Nixon pulls out the reverse sweep straight away, goes straight to short third man
conventional sweep this time, goes out to deep square-leg
misses his line, speared down leg
round the wicket, tries to work through midwicket but doesn't connect
flicks this into the square leg area
doosra and guess what, Nixon didn't pick it but he got a big stride and it was heading just over the timber
haha, another reverse sweep...somehow he connects and finds deep point (or is that deep square-leg now)
on middle and work to deep backward square
played from the crease, back up the pitch
pushed into the covers, Bopara can't find a gap in a tight field
drifting onto the pads and worked nicely through midwicket
full, outside off stump and driven to cover
forced back into his crease, pushed back to Fernando
and another reverse sweep from Nixon, single to the deep fielder
Bopara playing very deep in his crease, dabs into the off side
sweeps hard, but just a single out to deep square-leg
very full, dug out into the covers
top-edged sweep, falls short of the man at short fine-leg and is parried away by Silva
nice wrist work to send that into midwicket
forced through the covers, deep cover cleans up
uses his feet to the quick bowler, but all that effort only results in a drive to mid off
hint of reverse swing, takes the pad and down the on side...Fernando fields
took quick for Nixon, outside off stump and a wafty push and gets nowhere near it

tighter to the body, dropped into the off side and they set off for a quick one...Nixon was watching Bopara to make sure he was OK and nearly got caught short himself as Dilshan threw down the stumps...replay shows he made by a foot or so
flicked to midwicket, can't beat the field
gets a long way across and tickles to short fine leg, Sangakkara appeals and about 10 seconds later Jayasuriya joins it...shame it came off the bat
pushed past short cover
Nixon chips down the pitch and flicks up to long on
turned to short fine-leg, the scamper a quick single as the throw goes to the bowler's end....a direct hit and Bopara would have gone
connects well with this powerful sweep, speeds to deep square-leg
uses his strong wrists to beat midwicket for a single
on leg stump, flicked out to the deep fielder
full on middle, tucked to midwicket
drives away from his body, an edge flies down to third man
back of a length, back to the bowler
comes forward, pushes with one hand towards short cover
slower ball, Nixon feels for it but doesn't connect. It bobbles in front of Sangakkara who can't collect cleanly and it's byes...
outside off, turned away from him, and that's an attempted stumping
reverse sweep and that's behind square
prods down on that one, but sends a leading edge into the covers
driven, slowly, into the covers
outside off and that's swept to midwicket, looking for the second, and there's a flat throw but it would have needed to have been a direct throw to even have been worth asking for a replay
down the track to sweep and Bopara doesn't read that one
shuffled off the toes for an easy single on leg
pushed right up there, attempted yorker, not quite full enough to be classed as one but good enough to prevent the batsman doing anything other than defend
low full toss but Malinga gets away with that one, it's worked out only to midwicket and he will consider he's had a let-off
too good for the batsman, who's playing with some urgency and a hint of desperation, playing that down into the covers
a good delivery, yorker this time, and Bopara gets tangled up in playing that one and it does through the gap between bat and pad, past leg stump and on to Sangakkara
zeroes in on the good spot and that's defended down
on middle and that's swished to square for a quick single
played down off the back foot out to a wide long-on, and there's an easy single
horrible shot, coming back from outside off and he tries to reverse sweep but gets it all wrong
wide, wider, widest. Down leg
tries to sweep but doesn't get hold of it
plays it into cover
connects with the sweep this time but the sweeper, fittingly enough, sweeps up

low full toss which would have perhaps been wide down leg, but Bopara did well to decide to flick that wristily - he has very good wrists indeed - through midwicket and there's a flourish of a follow-through
good comeback from Malinga, that one pitching on off on a good length and defended down
outside edge, and that runs away to third man, a deliberate steer
right up there and dug out in front of off, Nixon going on to rehearse some bloody drives
driven forward and there's a quick single shuffled through
outside off, too much width, and that's driven over off
in the air in front of midwicket and that's a top-edged sweep, Jayasuriya with a great diving effort into the sun
down on one knee and that's swept again, Bopara looking cool under the pressure here, and he has a fine temperament
quick single to the legs, that's a stifled shout on the reverse sweep
another reverse sweep, this one bringing up the fifty partnership
outside off, dabbed down with soft hands and they think fleetingly about the single, but decide not to take it
outside off and the length's picked well and that's whipped in front of midwicket
down the track and lifts that over midwicket and in front of Malinga running in from the boundary - he fair cracked that one, but the fielder was there
got away with that one, slower ball and he popped that one up just shy of extra cover - the luck running with Bopara at the moment
charges down the track, clips it in front of midwicket, and Malinga does some excellent work to keep them to the single
driven down the ground for a single to long-off
low full toss and that runs away behind square, some good work from Nixon to take that off leg stump
short and Nixon comes down the track to pull that one towards the man sweeping on the leg-side boundary
full toss on off stump and Malinga gets away with that one, Bopara just playing it into the ground back to him
straighter and Bopara swipes that one behind square and they come back for the second
just outside off, a touch of room and that's driven to cover to bring up the 200
over the wicket, that's driven out to long-off and the batsmen choose to risk the second, and a diving Bopara makes sure he's back - although the throw was wide
down the track again but can only pick out the man at midwicket
outside off and Bopara drove that into his shin and there's a quick single
goes for a big aerial whoosh of a sweep off one knee, but can only tuck that one into the ground
connects with the reverse sweep but picks out the sweeper inside the boundary
outside edge flies in the air... but safe... directly behind the keeper. Ah, apparently it was off the pad
big reverse sweep and that just clears the man on the cover boundary - finally nails that shot and that's pretty cool, you have to say
another reverse sweep and that goes fine - the fielder chases it down, just gets a hand on it, but merely helps it on its way
outside off, Bopara lays bat on that one, driving it to cover
takes that from outside off to drive it in front of midwicket
great delivery, Bopara moving outside leg to give himself room to plant that through the off side - that goes down the corridor and he was nowhere near it
outside off and that's another calm delivery from Malinga, very good indeed, that on the spot and just worked forward

that must be the final blow, you'd expect. Big, big wicket that - Nixon went to smack that high over extra cover, but there just wasn't the room to bunt it that far, and that's a great effort from him
great clean strike of a cover drive - have to admire that one, just lacing that away. Malinga just flashes another of his beaming smiles
on off and that's a quick single - and, crucially for England, Bopara will now be on strike

so well played, so calm, Bopara helping that from off and merely presenting the face of the bat, a paddle, so delicate, and that runs away. Just uses the pace, and that runs over short fine leg and on its way
drives that through cover and they press back to get the second - and that's his fifty from 51 balls
outside off and that's driven out to the sweeper on the off side and Mahmood's now on strike
drives that one into his foot, it drops forward and they run the single

bowled him! Neck and crop! What a brilliant delivery; just back of a length, the perfect wicket-to-wicket delivery to clip the top of off. Great finish, well done Sri Lanka, well done Fernando. Great stuff!
